summary: The '123 GO Act' aims to enhance the competitiveness of the US nuclear sector in foreign countries. It directs the Secretary of State to negotiate new agreements for cooperation (123 agreements) under the Atomic Energy Act, aiming for at least 20 new agreements by 2029 and renegotiating expiring ones. The bill also establishes a program to support US nuclear suppliers, investors, and lenders in competing for international projects, focusing on expediting agreements, promoting international conventions, identifying and relieving export burdens, and encouraging the use of US nuclear technology.
